p: SARS-CoV HKU 39849 is relatively more stable than HuCoV 229E or OC43 and some other viral respiratory pathogens such as RSV. It is stable for 3 wk at RT in a liquid environment and after being dried on plastic, and its viability can be retained from 5 d to 2 wk at 22-25 °C at a relative humidity (RH) of 40-50%[ 37], which is like air conditioned indoor environments. It is easily killed at 56 °C for 15 min[ 37]. High RH of > 95% and at 28 °C or 33 °C did not significantly affect the infectivity of SARS-CoV HKU 39849. Increasing the temperature to 38 °C can suppress the virus. The viral viability was rapidly lost (3 log 10) at 38 °C and a RH of > 95%[ 37](Table 1).
